title: Why Apple products are so expensive. Does they justify their worth? - Quora

response.answer_text: Apples products can be broadly categorized into 3 parts. iPhonesiPadMac/Macbook1 - For iPhones, the competition has more or less caught up or even surpassed the individual features that an iPhone has. Still, they are a premium quality product and work well in the ecosystem. Ina few markets (like India) they are surely overpriced, but a part that blame is shared by the current taxation policy (But, with locally assembled iPhones that would not be applicable, since no Import duty would be levied) 2 - In the tablet category, unless you need Windows on a tablet for your professional needs, you cannot buy a tablet other than an iPad ( if the budget allows). There is no competition to Apple's tablet offering as on date (April, 2019) 3 - For Macbooks, they are good looking and have their pros, but the recent keyboard failures throw a dark shadow on the quality and longetivity of these products. Plus they are priced significantly higher compared to similar and even better offerings from competitors (eg. Dell XPS) For someone invested in Apple's ecosystem (having 2 or more of the above device), they can fully enjoy the purpose of these machines (features like handoff, etc.) For those looking to buy their 1st iPhones, the competition is good (or even better than them). Note : I'm typing this from 2016 S7 edge, so it isnt like smartphones from competing brands will fall apart in an year or two.

Apple designs their own software, which is more intensive than, say, a phone simply running on Google’s Android software. As a result, Apple phones are in their own unique class of mobile devices. Plus, the actual metals used in creating the phone are higher-end than any other smartphone. Creating a higher-quality phone naturally would increase the cost of it. But the fact that Apple can market a phone for $449 and still make a profit shows that they were clearly upping the price because they knew people would pay. And it’s actually a smart idea.
